page.title: 07NEW BUILDINGS IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: There is building in progress to renovate and convert some of the older buildings such as Potters Farm, and to modernise cottages. In-filling of modern housing has been allowed in Rectory Road, and there are bungalows on the edge of the village. The local planning committee controls all plans for new building: there is at present controversy about plans for new houses between the Green and Rectory Road. There is also an estate of sixteen council houses on Rectory Road: these were provided to a high standard by Norfolk County Council in 1914, each household having half an acre of land so that they could grow vegetables. An unusual home until recently has been the old railway carriage in a field near Valley Farm, but this is no longer occupied.
